result.title: Demonstration of coherent control schemes using XUV FELs
result.description: The consortium will demonstrate new schemes for the generation of multi-color coherent XUV radiation exploiting FELs. Using this approach, the network will investigated coherent control schemes in the XUV spectral range. In particular, the combination of multi-color coherent XUV radiation will be used to control the photoionization process and electronic dynamics in inner-valence shells in atoms and, eventually also in molecules. Finally we will also investigate novel approaches for the generation of attosecond pulse trains using XUV FELs.

result.title: System Architecture
result.description: This document will include an overall system architecture building upon the high level model presented here, covering overall system design, functional specifications for each of the WP5 components and high level component interactions. This document will also capture key technical decisions on areas such as: • Device / service discovery (e.g. UPnP) • Choice of client application environment (e.g. HbbTV2.0) • Media Application Component technology (e.g. HTML/JS/CSS) • Approach to device and content synchronisation (likely building upon second screen sync technology such as UPnP Multiscreen, DIAL, DVB CSS etc.) • Orchestration & Authoring approach, including • Layout and composition model • Production presentation requirements vocabulary

result.title: Platform-Component Interface Specifications
result.description: • Platform – Client Application Interface. Documentation specifying: • The platform APIs through which the client device application and the Media Application Components it hosts access platform services • Client application API by which the User Experience Engine managed client presentation. • Platform – Production Tool Interface. Documentation specifying: • The platform service APIs through which production tools will publish authored experiences, i.e. Media Application Components, underlying media assets and presentation requirements• Platform – Live Metadata Interface. Documentation specifying: • The platform service APIs through which live production metadata is ingested in real time into the platform. • Platform and Client Monitoring and Analytics Interface. Documentation specifying: • The platform and client APIs to support monitoring and analytics functionality

result.title: Ethical Data Management and Data Management Plan: year 1
result.description: The deliverable will comprise two sections the first on Ethical data management will cover: * Report on the privacy policies that will be used by the project and the different OER sites. These should specifically include the use of user data for research purposes * Details of consent gathering for minors (forms and data management policy) * Ethical clearance from the relevant DPAs or existing ethics boards for the activities in different countries * Report on the legality of the final product under GDPR * description of the algorithms used for machine learning and their ethical implications * identify data controllers and processors The second section of the report will be the Data Management Plan as part of the Open Research Data Pilot and will cover: the handling of research data during and after the end of the project * what data will be collected, processed and/or generated * which methodology and standards will be applied * whether data will be shared/made open access and * how data will be curated and preserved (including after the end of the project).

result.title: A Proposal for Access Control Models for Multi-tenancy
result.description: This deliverable will assess current approaches for access control and propose novel models, based on current progress in ABAC models, to cope with multi-tenancy requirements and in particular with distributed attributes. A mapping between these ABAC-based models to enforceable policy languages (e.g. XACML) will be proposed, including the design of an enforcement component to parse, interpret and execute access control policies.

result.title: First real-world and online learning community engagement plan
result.description: This deliverable will be based upon a study of which “real world” activities (meetups, focus groups, user analytics), the social media channels (mailing lists, wikis, blogs) to be strategically targeted by the project, and will plan a series of X5gon organized events. A plan will be put in place for feedback solicitation and continued engagement. In particular we will propose how impact related to those channels will be monitored throughout the project’s timeline.

result.title: Prototype Service Descriptions: Initial version
result.description: Description of the user experience for each of the use cases. These use cases will not be equally mature as the delivery date of theatre is sooner than MotoGP, which is in turn sooner than the Football use case. These should be developed in an appropriate form (e.g. textual, storyboard, promotional video) and will provide clear descriptions about what a user will expect to happen. The technical work packages will be able to define requirements and specifications based on these descriptions. The initial descriptions should not be considered ‘gospel’ but are starting points for negotiation.

result.title: Theatre trial evaluation results
result.description: This will probably be a written report, accompanied by rich media (e.g. video/documentary material) to make the trial easy to visualise. In any case the deliverable must serve to describe the Theatre trials and provide an evaluation of their results. The form of the evaluation cannot be defined yet; it could be user centric, and may be qualitative or quantitative, or it may be market centric and address issues that are more commercial. The form it takes will be determined in T4.1

result.title: Project Handbook
result.description: The Project Handbook aims at supporting X5gon partners to manage all the administrative and organizational aspects of the project. The document provides introductions to the overall administration and reporting procedures, referring to the official EC documentation and to the contractual documents where details can be found. Other aspects treated in the document are project management and coordination procedures.
